background: Learn Go module system (go mod init, go get, replace) and set up a CLI skeleton using Cobra or urfave/cli. This prepares you for scalable Go CLI apps.
Build a small React app using only hooks (useState, useEffect). Focus on lifting state up and avoiding class components entirely.
Understand how SQLite stores data on disk (pages, b-trees) and practice writing CREATE TABLE with constraints, primary keys, and foreign keys.
Explore channels (buffered/unbuffered) and implement a worker pool pattern for concurrent processing.
Learn the difference between controlled and uncontrolled inputs. Build a form managed entirely with useState.
Use EXPLAIN QUERY PLAN to see how SQLite executes queries. Compare indexed vs non-indexed performance.
Learn how interfaces enable loose coupling in Go. Write a mock implementation for unit testing.
Use the Context API to replace prop drilling. Build a theme switcher that works app-wide.
Design a schema with multiple tables. Practice writing joins, nested queries, and aggregates.
Use encoding/json to decode API responses into structs and encode Go structs into JSON.
Use the useReducer hook for complex state logic. Compare with Redux in terms of complexity and setup.
Learn transactions in SQLite and understand the ACID properties. Practice rollback and commit operations.
Learn idiomatic error handling in Go. Create custom error types and wrap errors.
Use useMemo and React.memo to optimize performance. Avoid unnecessary renders in expensive calculations.
Learn about triggers in SQLite. Build one for audit logging table changes.
Build a REST API in Go with Gorilla/Mux or Chi and connect it to SQLite.
Learn routing in React with nested routes and URL params. Build a small multi-page app.
Implement FTS5 search in SQLite to make text queries fast and efficient.
Write table-driven tests in Go using the testing package.
Use React portals to render components outside the DOM hierarchy. Implement an accessible modal.
Export data from SQLite to CSV/JSON and import data from external sources.
Build a file downloader using goroutines with progress tracking and error handling.
Implement fan-in and fan-out concurrency patterns to process multiple data streams.
Learn error boundaries in React to catch runtime errors in components.
Learn to create partial and covering indexes for performance tuning.
Use context.Context for request cancellation and deadlines.
Prevent unnecessary function re-creations with useCallback and check performance in DevTools.
Go backend, SQLite DB, and React frontend for a simple task management tool with filters.
Learn Common Table Expressions to simplify complex queries.
Learn sync.Mutex and sync.RWMutex for thread-safe access to shared resources.
Build a reusable custom hook for data fetching with loading and error states.
Configure SQLite behavior using PRAGMA commands like journal_mode and synchronous.
Work with dates and times, formatting and parsing with the time package.
Validate props at runtime with PropTypes and define default values.
Full-stack app with Go, SQLite, and React to track expenses with category filters.
Write a custom SQLite extension in Go or C.
Implement logging and timing middleware for HTTP servers.
Use React Suspense for asynchronous data loading.
Use ROW_NUMBER, RANK, LEAD, and LAG for advanced analytics.
Generate HTML using Go templates with dynamic data.
Use styled-components or Emotion for scoped component styling.
Build a bookmarks manager with Go API, SQLite backend, and React frontend.
Use golang-migrate to manage database schema changes.
Work with streaming JSON decoders to handle large API payloads efficiently without loading everything into memory.
Use React DevTools profiler to identify and optimize slow rendering components.
Understand and enable WAL mode to improve concurrency and performance in SQLite.
Use iota for auto-incrementing constants and create neat enum-like constructs.
Add ARIA roles, manage keyboard navigation, and ensure screen reader compatibility.
Build a notes app with Go API, Markdown support, React live preview, tagging, and dark mode toggle.
Programmatically back up and restore SQLite databases safely.
Write benchmarks with go test -bench to measure and optimize performance.
Split your React app into chunks and load components lazily with React.lazy and Suspense.
Plan your full-stack project features and architecture. Initialize Git repo, Go modules, React project, and SQLite database.
Organize your Go project folders (cmd/, internal/, pkg/). Build a basic HTTP server using Gorilla/Mux or Chi.
Set up React with react-router-dom. Create placeholder pages: Dashboard, Project Details, Settings.
Design SQLite schema for projects, tasks, tags, users. Use migrations with golang-migrate.
Implement JWT authentication in Go. Create React auth context and login/register pages.
Build backend endpoints and frontend forms for creating, listing, updating, and deleting projects.
Manage tasks linked to projects with due dates and status; implement inline editing in React.
Add markdown-capable notes linked to projects with a React markdown editor and live preview.
Implement full-text search in SQLite and add search and filter UI components in React.
Create backend user profile endpoints and frontend settings page for editable user data.
Add SQLite indexes to speed up joins and optimize dashboard queries.
Implement file upload handling in Go, link files to projects, store metadata in SQLite, and files on disk.
Add in-memory caching in Go for frequent queries and implement cache invalidation.
Use memoization, lazy loading, and code splitting to optimize frontend performance.
Add rate limiting and data validation middleware to protect your backend.
Implement dark/light theme switching in React using Context API.
Add in-app toast notifications in React and email alerts from the backend.
Write unit tests and HTTP handler tests in Go using the testing and httptest packages.
Write Jest and React Testing Library tests for critical components.
Dockerize your Go API and SQLite database. Test locally with docker-compose.
Build the React app for production and serve via Go backend or static hosting.
Set up GitHub Actions pipeline to run tests, build and deploy automatically.
Add logging middleware and integrate basic analytics or error tracking.
Write technical docs, API reference, and usage guides for your app.
Fix bugs, improve UI/UX, and add any missing small features before launch.
Use tools like hey or k6 to perform load tests on your backend API.
Audit your app for SQL injection, XSS, CSRF, and update dependencies.
Implement backup and restore endpoints for your SQLite database.
Deploy your app to a staging environment and test with real-world data.
Deploy your app live on a platform like Fly.io, Railway, or DigitalOcean.
Announce your project, gather feedback, and plan the next version.
